thread.title: Jharkhand HC Stays JSSC CGL Result Amid Paper Leak Row, Next Hearing On July 15

author: @cnnnews18
title: Jharkhand HC Stays JSSC CGL Result Amid Paper Leak Row, Next Hearing On July 15
text:
Jharkhand HC Stays JSSC CGL Result Amid Paper Leak Row, Next Hearing On July 15
JSSC CGL Paper Leak: The division bench, comprising Chief Justice MS Ramachandra Rao and Justice Rajesh Shankar, maintained the ban on releasing the result.
JSSC CGL Paper Leak: The Jharkhand High Court heard the petition filed regarding the paper leak of the Jharkhand Staff Selection Commissionâ€™s CGL exam. The division bench, comprising Chief Justice MS Ramachandra Rao and Justice Rajesh Shankar, maintained the ban on releasing the JSSC CGL result.
Advocate Sanjay Piperwal represented the Jharkhand Staff Selection Commission, while advocate Ajit Kumar represented the petitioner. The next hearing is scheduled for July 15.
Prakash Kumar filed the petition to cancel the JSSC CGL exam, citing irregularities and demanding its cancellation. He also requested that the exam be conducted by the CBI or a committee of retired High Court judges. During the last hearing, the state government sought more time.
View All
View all
The JSSC combined graduate level examination took place on September 21 and 22, 2024. Students reported that only 82 candidates passed the exam on September 21, while 2149 candidates passed that was held on September 22.
The recruitment aims to fill 863 posts of Assistant Branch Officer, 335 of Junior Secretariat Assistant, 182 of Labor Enforcement Officer, 5 of Planning Assistant, 252 of Block Supply Officer, and 185 of Zonal Officer.
